reviews.review_msg: I took MBB420 (Special Topics in Biochemistry) with Dr. Paetzel and thoroughly enjoyed it. He was clear about expectations, and the concepts were well explained. Exams and grading were very fair. It's always great to learn from someone passionate about the subject. I highly recommend this course.

Spring 2023: Would not seek him out as a prof but he was ok. Slides had a ridiculous amount of information on them and He does not say a single word on the slides during the lecture. exams can have very specific questions as well. His exams were decent but there was a time crunch and tutorials were optional. He ain't that bad just very monotone.

Dr. Paetzel did a pretty good job. The exams were fairly easy, but there was a ton of material to memorize. The lectures were pretty dry at times, but the content was actually interesting. Dr. Paetzel was always available after class to answer any questions students might have.
As I prepare for this second midterm I am realizing this degree ain't for me.

Dr. Paetzel is a truly passionate professor. He loves the work that he does and it shows in his in person teaching. He records all the lectures for students to review, and creates his slides pulling directly from the textbook making it easy to study. The exams are fair and he is open to feedback. Do your homework and show up to class to do well!

Dr. Paetzel's lectures are extremely dry and pretty disorganized. He is also very inaccessible outside of class (he does not even respond to emails of the TA). His exams are mediocre at best, time-limiting and he marks rather harshly, especially on assignments. I'd recommend waiting for another professor.

Professor Paetzel is a good prof and fairly accessible since he is always available for questions after the lecture. You can tell that he is very passionate about proteins but the lectures are sometimes dry. Make sure to understand and memorize the slides and you will be set! Also tutorials really help you understand the material.

Dr. Paetzel was never accessible outside of lecs and the TAs weren't too helpful in answering questions. Not enough practice and very heavy lectures, so most of the course had to be self-taught. Exam questions were asked vaguely but required an answer identical to the answer key. Almost an impossible A regardless of how much content you know.

Dr. Paetzel wasn't bad but also not great by any means. His lectures are very monotone and definitely not for everyone, though I didnt mind them. His test questions come directly off his slides - and are either 1) incredibly easy or 2) wildly difficult and specific. Overall, I'd take a course with him again but I wouldn't seek him out as a prof.

Lecture slides are more helpful than his actual live lectures, assignments are literally just regurgitating lecture slides, exams only cover a fraction of the material so you'll waste time studying things that wont even be tested and mark will not respond to any questions. The class isn't too hard but you'll be teaching yourself

dr. paetzel is a very intelligent person however lectures based on anything besides his specialty of proteins can be hard to watch. He has very detailed lecture slides but will go through the whole lecture without reading any of the words on them. If you study outside of class time doing textbook readings and studying the lec notes you will be fine

As others mentioned , he is ghost. Very dry and boring lectures & slides. He didn't reply to single emails. Assignments are all summarizing lectures. You have to watch his lectures and write summarization. and they grade assignment based on grammer like Engl class. No practice Qs , No preparation for midterms. Also TAs are useless. AVOID at any cos

Don't expect Dr. Paetzel to respond to your emails. He is a ghost outside of class time. He has very good slides, but the lectures are useless cause he just reads them. The exams are also not marked fairly; if you don't write the answer key exactly, you'll be marked off. Avoid him if you can!

Tutorials have no structure and the course overall is super exam heavy. It would be expected that the prof would provide some form of preparation such as extra assignments. Overall, the lectures are very thorough and interesting.

Avoid this course with Dr. Paetzel. He is not accessible, does not reply to emails, lectures are very disorganized and dry. Most assignments are very short and ask for Summarizing his lectures rather than providing practice for exams. Moreover, assignments are due the day of the exam. Would recommend waiting for another professor.
This guy has probably the most dry lectures I've ever seen. Exams are way too hard and the marking is extremely picky. The TA is also pretty useless.

A lot of people don't really understand Dr. Paetzel, but he really cares about his students and their well-being. He wants to make sure that everyone understands what is being taught, and does a very good job of explaining the material. There are weekly assignments for completion marks, and exams are on par with assignments in terms of difficulty.
Dr. Paetzel is a pretty good prof. He always leaves time for questions at the end of each lecture, and exams are fair. It would be nice to see grading scales in the syllabus though.
Rarely answered questions students had, and basically required you to memorize his information-heavy lectures slides in order to get a decent grade (not a great way to learn the material).
Mark was one of the best profs !! He was super understanding throughout the semester and he gave fair exams.

Mark is one of the nicest profs!! He was extremely understanding and takes mental health very seriously. His exams are all based off his lecture slides, so I recommend memorizing all the slides and understanding those concepts. I barely used the textbook at all. Also, I would say that the difficulty of the exams is moderate.

Mark is the sweetest professor ever! He doesn't reply to emails, but he has open discussion boards where you can ask questions, tries to answer questions during class time and hosts office hours once a week. Test material is fair and forces you to apply concepts to demonstrate your understanding. *I took this course remotely due to the pandemic*

I don't know why some reviews say that he is approachable. Well, let me tell you he's not. Doesn't answer emails about course-related content. Normally has office hours right after class, which is no good because students have other classes too. Canvas quizzes are worded poorly, good for reading practice, the meaning of the quiz is unmined.
level of difficulty 0/5 but there is no such option so went with 1/5 :) Attendance is optional as there are video recording posted on canvas

He is an amazing professor that loves what he teaches and he does want you to do well also. He's super approachable and all of his tests are on his lectures only. But you do need to put in the effort to see the results. This is MBB after all. I would love to have him as a professor again.

most boring prof I have ever had. he only writes on a chalk board and you have to copy everything down including complex molecules and mechanisms which he often enough makes errors drawing. his first test is a piece of cake, second test was okay, and as for the final it is extremely unclear what is expected to be known, or what will be tested.

Great professor all around. Had a really relaxed pace compared to other professors in the same major. Going from being hit in the head with a sledgehammer repeatedly in 331 to a laid back class like his was heavenly. Number one tip for success: if he writes it down on the board you better write it down in your notes.

Mark is an amazing prof, he is super nice and loves the material that he is teaching. He goes at a much slower pace than any science class I have ever taken. there is probably 3-5 pages of notes per lecture total and his exams are completely based off those notes. He only writes stuff on the board so you gotta copy that

Dr. Paetzel was the nicest prof ever! He really cared about his students and really wanted his students to do well. The material wasn't too difficult, but make sure you attend lecture and take good notes. Review the lecture objectives and your notes from lectures before exams and you'll do fine!
Mark is a great prof, clearly explains the material and tells you what to expect for exams. The course is pretty memorization heavy, but he makes the class interesting.

Dr. Paetzel wants his students to do well. He provides lots of extra time for help and will make sure you understand the material before you leave. The material may come off as boring to some but his interest and enthusiasm in course material just carries through. If you just try you are bound to learn something. Overall great Prof!
He's the nicest prof ever! The class isn't hard if you study the lecture material.
Course was not too hard. Usual MBB class. The teacher however was horrible. Disappointed! Waste of time and money.

I loved this course and I think mostly because Dr. Paetzel was so interested in the material that it made me really enjoy his lectures. His exams are based on the lecture material and going to class is highly suggested as he often directs you to the key concepts to study. The exams & problem sets are very fair. Highly suggest you take this class!

He is the nicest prof I have ever met during my university years. Dr P is extremely passionate about protein studies and that's awesome. One comment: His extreme interest passion level equals his niceness which also equals his INABILITY to teach.

He is a really nice person and extremely approachable. Sometimes the material was a bit boring but he did try to make it interesting. The exams are very fair and straight from the notes. Read the papers he tells you to and you'll ace the exam. If you're going to take this class, take it with him.
He is SUCH a nice person, a sweetheart! As a prof, he explains things well but it's so hard to listen because the material is very dry...

He is a terrible prof. Not only that, he isn't very understanding of his students, kind of indifferent to them like they are part of an experiment he doesn't really care about? I honestly think profs like him shouldn't be allowed to teach, as having basic social skills should be a requirement to be a professor.

He is seriously the WORST PROF EVER! He can't even keep the class' attention for more than 1 minute. After the first minute, half the class is already gone, and the other half has fallen asleep. He is completely out of touch with his students and it's clear he doesn't get out of his lab much, and maybe he should just stay there to save all of us?

Although his lectures may seem boring but he has a depth knowledge of what he teaches. His exams are straight forward from the lecture notes. Make sure you study the diagrams in the notes in and out. He likes proteins so much. Tutorial are very helpful. He got a great team of TAs. Overall, he is a good prof.

Can't blame the guy for having boring lectures. I mean there really is no other way to talk in an interesting way about the stuff we go through. Hes a nice guy and puts in a bit of dry humor. Exams were rather hard and went into great detail. Textbook was really helpful in this class.

His first time teaching 222, didnt know how to make the first exam, but got better after. His lec are extremely boring, have to read the slide before talking most of the time. Be sure to study the notes well and the previous mts. His questions are straight of the notes, and he will a few questions that go into more depth. He loves his bonds.

Class was simple enough, however the material is extremely boring. His exams are straight forward and out of the notes. Although this is an easy class, if you have no interest in proteins DO NOT TAKE IT. You will find studying to be a very brutal chore.
His lectures are always clear and very interesting. He includes the history of the field as well as the most up to date findings. One of the best profs I have ever had.

I agree with the comment below. He is extremely disorganized, unprepared and hard to follow this semester. The notes are never updated and usually people have no idea what is going on in class. Some class material is extremely repetitive and he skips over a lot of the other stuff.

I don't know what happened to this man, but he is now a very different person.  Even my TA who had him before said the same thing.  His lectures are slow, the notes are never updated or sent out on time, and he alleges that he does not want you to memorize, but yet his second midterm had a list of vocabulary to fill out.  This was brutal.
BEST MBB PROFESSOR!!!  HE'S ALWAYS HELPFUL AND UNDERSTAND!!
the coolest MBB prof ever!!!  He's the man!
better MBB prof ever, seriously
Always 10 or more minutes late
Great new prof.  He makes the uninteresting, interesting.
